Reviews.Title: “small, but decent.”
Reviews.Author: thexev
Reviews.Content: Being that I'd never been to London before I was kinda expecting to be staying somewhere tiny, which is what this place was. I'm a pretty tiny person, so this wasn't a big deal for me. Don't think anyone taller than me would've appreciated the shower though. If I were a few inches taller I'd have to duck. Another thing to note about the shower, if you don't catch it at the right time you will have to suffer through a cold shower. A couple of times I ended up boiling some water to wash my head in the kitchen sink with. The floor was a bit grubby. Could've used a good sweep. You'll be able to hear any neighbouring guests. Other than that though, I found it alright. I didn't have to hand over any ID and my payment online was accepted and I wasn't charged for anything extra. It's located close to Lancaster Gate and Paddington tube stations as well as the Paddington National Rail station. Located in a residential area so it's not as noisey as some areas of London. Over all I probably wouldn't stay here again, but he price was ok and the room wasn't terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Kieran T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice place at a great location. Just don't be surprised when you are charged TWICE for your booking like I was! Booked the place through 'easybook.com' and payed the 120 pound for two rooms, then was told on my arrival I had to pay again. Made a mug of to be honest but the hotel room wasn't to bad.

Reviews.Title: “MY OPINION”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was rather disappointed since I expected more comfort and from the picture on the site the appartment hotel looks smarter than it is actually.Moreover,on the day of our arrival,nobody was expecting us to welcome us so we had to wait at the door for half an hour at least.I consider that to be unacceptable all the more that THE PRICE IS NOT SO CHEAP AND THE PLACE IS LOCATED IN A RESIDENTIAL AREA.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, well-located”
Reviews.Author: Bradsky
Reviews.Content: I found the room super clean and the double studio was a good size for just me. It was great to have a kitchenette and that saved me a lot of money not having to eat out all the time. There is a Tesco Metro supermarket about 5 minutes walk away and a very efficient launderette/service wash about 1 block away. The staff was very helpful, friendly, and responsive, especially Claudia the cleaner and Robert the maintenance person. It's right in the center of London, about 5 blocks from Paddington railway and tube station. The internet was ok (not really high speed) at mid-day or late at night. Otherwise it was very, very slow or pretty much non-existent. (I had to pay 65 pounds for 12 nights internet!) If you are charging for internet it had better be fast and reliable. The hotel advertises that it has satellite tv. Yes they do, but the satellite channels are only viewable if you can speak Spanish, Polish or Russian. The only English channels are what's available via antenna, BBC1, BBC2, BBC4 and ITV1. No Sky channels or anything else. The mattress was comfortable but a bit too firm for me. There was a very small, very flimsy folding chair to sit on, otherwise it was the bed or the floor. Overall, the room was very clean, no frills, well-located and good value for what you get. But for the slow, unreliable internet, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, pity about the noise”
Reviews.Author: scotsgirl9
Reviews.Content: when we arrived we were allowed to check in early, great after having a night flight into london. went to pay and was told that there would be a 5per cent surcharge for using a debit card which was not uk register - we are from scotland and have a scottish bank account!!!! so we paid cash. room was small but all we needed for a 1 night stay. spotless rooms, and the maid came by and asked if everything was ok. we asked for a couple of extra towels which was promptly got for us. perfect place to stay for hyde park (our destination for proms in the park) and a 10 min walk from paddington train station. however the beds creaked evrytime you moved and you could hear every little noise in the building, which didnt help when the other guests were making such a noise until 4am!! they were banging doors so hard that the window in my room shook! it even sounded like someone had a washing machine on at midnight!! for Â£100 a night i would expect some soundproofing between the rooms. very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in a coffin”
Reviews.Author: Owen_K_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed last week for business and had to leave and sleep on my friends couch as it was that horrible. The Staff The receptionist whilst nice had no idea I had booked a room, then spent 20 mins chasing her manager who said I had booked one. Payment was supposed to have been taken before I arrived and they then added a 5% surcharge which wasn't listed on late rooms. Payment They also had our company card details written down on a post it note with the CSV number in plain view of everyone. The card had to be cancelled for security purposes. Be very careful with your card details, and don't let them photocopy your passport or driving licence. The Room How they have the cheek to say it is an apartment.. more like a small bedsit. The bed was small but I had booked a single, it was hard the bed looked like it was cobbled together from bits of other beds and made so much noise when you moved a tiny bit. The bathroom was so small that I had to have the room door open whilst using the bathroom. The kitchenette was awful, no kettle, no tea, no coffee, no cups, no spoons, no plates basically nothing. Internet Â£10 per day (it was advertised as free) or you can use the BT Openzone and pay Â£5 per day. Value At Â£73 for a tiny room for one night this was not good value for money, in fact I would say you should pay even slightly more and stay somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best for the price”
Reviews.Author: Globalloco
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving I checked in at the office, as others have said I wasn't thrilled about the copy of my passport. In addition to this I was asked for Â£250 in cash to pay for my room. When I asked to pay by card as I was travelling for business, the gentleman on reception pulled a face. I asked if they had a machine and he said yes but that there would be a 5% charge for the priviledge, he showed me some small print but this was not on my online booking. Tired, I agreed to pay, he then asked for a Â£250 pre authorisation which was fine but I didn't understand why they then needed written details of my credit card. My room was on the floor level with the road which was by and large fine noise wise apart from when someone used the front door I could hear every footstep, breath, conversation etc. The room was clean but worn, you can definitely get better for Â£125 per night. It put me in mind of a student bedsit, none of the furniture or soft furnishings matches. The shower room was tiny but adequate, towels are very small though! There was a wardrobe, plenty ofplugs, iron, kitchen, tv, DVD and phone. All fine and in working order. Bed was fairly comfy but no duvet just a sheet and a blanket. The best thing going for this 'hotel' is it's location. A five minute walk to Paddington at most, loads of nice restaurants and bars. Overall I wouldn't recommend it though, it's not an apartment, the staff are quite cold and rooms are worn.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious but clean”
Reviews.Author: Rasperry
Reviews.Content: We booked a room ensuite with open kitchen and it was not bad at all. We had read some bad reviews of this hotel, but our room was quite nice and confortable. It had Sky TV and a DVD player, and all the kitchenware. The location is excellent, ten minutes away from Paddington Station, and it has a very good prize. The worse was the man of the staff..

Reviews.Title: “Don t stay here. Sewage stink in basement.”
Reviews.Author: Ivbnhad
Reviews.Content: Don t stay here. Sewage stink in basement. I got very sick which ruined our time in Singapore probably from ecoil from bad drains. After all London is a very old city and the drains are equally old. Extremely small apartment. False advertising. Australians expect basic cleanliness which on the surface seemed ok but DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the basement”
Reviews.Author: Warren163
Reviews.Content: Terrible sewage smell in basement -denied by the management - but we noted an air freshener had been provided in the room. Unsatisfactoty TV reception in the basement. A shame as we were looking forward to UK TV. Twin room OK in size - adequate kitchen - no plugs or washing up liquid.( basics surely!!) Location excellent. Just don't accept a room in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be conned - avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: Naughto
Reviews.Content: Dylan House; also known as Dylan Apartments or Dylan Paddington - as Trip Advisor could confirm I have never written a negative review before, but this place is the pits. My partner and I pre-booked and paid through Wotif. com. for what was supposed to be a self contained "apartment". When we arrived we were impressed with the location, the streetscape and the outside of the building. Even the entrance hall made us think we had made a good choice. At their office room they confirmed our booking but said they needed my credit card details and to photocopy my passport (which I was not comfortable about). However we were given no choice about this; If we did not comply, then we could not stay even though we had already paid through Wotif. We would forfeit our money. We were then given a key to a room in the basement. We had to negotiate a very narrow staircase with all our baggage. My partner had broken her arm in a fall in Spain the day before but there was no offer of help to carry our baggage. I had to make 3 trips up and down the steep narrow stairs. Once we reached our room we had a problem. There was not enough space for us to have our baggage in the room and for us to be in the room at the same time. The only solution was to put our 2 cases and 2 daypacks on the bed and then move them onto the floor as we were ready for bed. Our "apartment" had no chair. There was simply no room. The tiny door to the equally tiny bathroom did not open or close properly. Whenever we or any of our neighbours flushed a toilet or ran a tap/ shower, a methane type smell went though our room. The only natural light was through a very small window to a light-well. There was no tea or coffee in the room which was lucky because there was only 1 cup. In the basement there appeared to be 5 "apartments". If there was a fire on the upper floors I doubt very much that we would have been able to escape. To finish off our experience with Dylan Apartments; when we arrived home to Australia I had a request to contact my bank urgently. Within a couple of hours of me providing my credit card details to Dylan House and allowing staff to photocopy my passport, on-line purchases in UK and USA were made using my card details. I had not used that particular card in the preceding 6 days as all our other prepaid accommodation did not request we provide this information on booking in. Do not be conned by website photos or description of what you are getting. Do not be conned into giving your credit card or passport details. We stayed in lots of nice places around UK and Europe. Places like Dylan Apartments/ Dylan Paddington/ Dylan House should be avoided if at all possible

Reviews.Title: “Take earplugs & tea bags!”
Reviews.Author: xxBabyDollxx
Reviews.Content: When looking on the website to book we didn't expect much but it was fairly cheap & near where we needed to be so we just went for it. Just as we were boarding the plane to London we received a phone call saying we had been re-located to their property in earl's court due to a problem with the rooms. We flat out refused as the reason we were were visiting London was for an event near Paddington & they then changed their story & said there was only twin rooms available. Now having read these reviews & seen some pics of the double rooms I am glad this happened as our twin room was very spacious compared to the doubles! When we arrived the man on reception demanded credit card details even though we had already paid & refused to tell us why they needed them. Pros: great location, fairly cheap, nice area Cons: walls are paper thin (woken frequently through the night by toilet flushes, noisy children), kettle but no tea bags, coffee or sugar. no washing up liquid or anyway to do dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: SPA71
Reviews.Content: Great Location near Paddington railway/tube - rooms are small(very small) but clean and comfy. We stayed in the basement and might not be good for claustrofobic people. Only roof windows but then again cool and very quiet. We stayed two nights and where very happy with the accomodations. When we are returning to London the Dylan House will definetely will be on our list of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Okay with Good location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyDlivo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, the first two in a triple room cause that's all they had left, which really should just be a double room, but they've just shoved a 3rd bed into it. Checked out but had to stay a 3rd night due to flights rearrangements and ended up in an actual double room on the top floor which was TINY!. The room was clean enough, but should be cleaner. Mould in the bathroom tile grout which I hate and the shower head itself needed a scrub. But a good location, lots of cheap food places around and keep an eye out for the convenience store around the corner that has internet for 1 Pound an hour. Bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: Kodac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Dylan Studios for a 3 day weekend. I found the reception staff very friendly and helpful. I was on the third floor. There are no lifts, so if you have problems with stairs, this is probably not a good place to stay. I had some heavy luggage, but they sent some staff to help me with it. I was in a double room, which was super small, but it had the kitchen and bathroom, was very clean, and was in about the condition I expected. I even had a view over the street behind. So for the cost of the room, for somewhere safe to sleep and leave my gear, I was quite happy. The walls are paper thin, so you can hear people coming and going all the time, but you can't go past the location and it was better than other serviced apartments that I've stayed in the Bayswater area.

Reviews.Title: “fine room in budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: milkshakespear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dylan Hotel for 3 nights/4 days and found it perfect for a short citytrip. It's located near Hydepark, just a five minutes walk from the Lancaster Gate (underground) station, in a quiet neighbourhood with several restaurants, a pub and supermarkets around the corner. Our room (13) was small but big enough for 2 people. We were out sightseeing all day anyway so we just wanted a private place to have breakfast and a good nights sleep. The room was very clean and we got new towels daily. Even the bedlinnen was changed. We had a good bed and a nice warm shower with free shampoo, soap and showercaps. We made our own coffee and toast each morning. The little kitchen was perfect for a short citytrip. The staff was friendly and helpful. Maybe the hotel is a little noisy at times but then again; it's an old building which is exactly why it is more charming than any modern concrete block Holiday Inn-like place. So, no complaints here, we had a really nice time! If you are looking for a friendly budget place to stay this is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: mamu_9
Reviews.Content: Appalling customer service... I wish I never booked this hotel! Any reputable agency - online of offline should think twice before doing business with Dylan house (London). Hopefully sooner or later they will realize and stop dealing with them. The only reason I booked 2 nights at this hotel via www.bookings.com was close proximity to where I needed to be in London last weekend of October for my NLP seminar. I was called from the hotel only 3 days before arrival date to be informed that they had some maintenance work going on and no rooms were available. Nobody bothered to apologize for inconvenience. I had to find another hotel nearby. A month later while checking my credit card statement I realized that Dylan House still charged me Â£77 - one nights fee. When I phoned to inquire about the charge, both - bookings.com and Dylan House replied, that this was a cancellation fee for no show.... Please, be aware and try to avoid this hotel at all cost!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Pretzel7777
Reviews.Content: Thanks a lot to Dylan house because when i booked a studio with them i was scared after reading the reviews,but when i reached there and stayed for 42 days i found it amazing.The staff was very helpful and caring,the room standards are excellent.Actually i must say it was worth what i paid for to stay.Special thanks goes to Mr.Rajat who surprised me on my birthday by putting a nice bottle of champagne and a heart shaped cake in my room when i was away,and as soon as i opened my room it was decorated with flowers and ribbons.My wife was so happy and this is what i expected from my tour that i wanted to make my wife happy,I will prefer to come here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, peaceful placce, centraally located”
Reviews.Author: john420
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at dylan. Especially having kitchens in the apartments is the biggest advantage. Nice clean rooms and looked newly refurbished

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: EricDubboNSW
Reviews.Content: We booked Dylan House over the internet and were sadly disappointed. The rooms that we were allocated bore little resemblance to those advertised on the hotel's web page. The one staff member present told us that there were deluxe rooms that featured on the internet, but none of them were available. Our room was one of those where you have to climb over your luggage once you close the door. The ensuite was tiny with room for one person to stand (not move) between the toilet, basin and shower recess. Our friends had three adults in a similarly cramped room with windows opening onto an internal courtyard full of cigarette butts.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: newlifemedia
Reviews.Content: I actually enjoyed my stay at Dylan House. I arrived late after taking longer than I expected to get from Heathrow Airport. When I tried paying for the room for 6 nights the receptionist discovered that my Credit card had insufficient funds so she happily accepted cash for one night and said I could pay the rest the next day, and that paying cash would be better for me because they have to charge 5% on Credit card payments. The room was very small, as was the bathroom, but, in my opinion, so what. I was in London to see the sights not spend all day in my room. The walls were thin and I could hear people walking around upstairs and in the hallway, but again, so what. It's a small boutique hotel, not a Hilton or a Best Western. The location was extremely handy to everything - close to Paddington Tube Station and many great restaurants and mini-marts. The staff were very helpful, and when, after coming home from a long day seeing the sights and discovering I had accidentally booked my room for 5 nights instead of 6, the guy in reception told me that they had a room available at their other hotel at Earl's Court and that I could stay there as I had paid for 6 nights. He was very apologetic, even though it was entirely my fault. I would recommend this hotel if: a) You don't expect luxury b) Budget is an issue c) You only need a place to sleep after sight seeing all day

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spaddy
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel, dylan house is a modern and accommodating offering that provided what i needed, a small hideaway not to far from the centre of london and with all the basic amenities that were of a particularly good standard. I had booked a studio double room with ensuite for me and a friend for a 2 night break. When we got into the room it was a typical compact studio room that was clean and fresh, with the ensuite and kitchenette of a high standard of cleanliness. The ensuite was cosy but not to small to feel claustatphobic. The kitchenette was useful for us, as we wanted to keep our food costs down. The storage facilities, clean cutlery and nicely sized fridge , on top of the plasma tv was all a bonus, as was the added storage space which was plenty for 2 nights. We were on the top floor, which suited us perfectly. The couple of stairs up was worth the quietness that the top floor offered us. I was also aware that some studio rooms can get stuffy but the fan unit provided was a great asset to stop this. I would say that while the rooms were clean and of a good standard, we did have a problem with our DVD player, which would not work. I went down to the main office and the man was very obliging in sending someone up. However, whilst the man did his best to solve the problem it was plain to see that he had no more knowledge than i did. He did promise a new dvd player would be brought up but this promise was broken. This was the only bad aspect of the service. On every other occasion the office maintained a friendly atmosphere with service always being offered with a smile. Overall i was impressed by the standard available on my basic budget and would book to stay at Dylan's house again. I would however be mindful that Dylan house is best for those after a short break of 3-4 days and i would advice those, especially people looking for a compact studio room to a center and of a good standard to choose Dylan's house.

Reviews.Title: “Agree - don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: nomadwannabes
Reviews.Content: We ignored the general feedback here and booked a night at the Dylan Hotel, to our cost! We were put in room 41. We have stayed in all sorts of hotels, many basic and small (weâ€™re not into 4*), but not like this. It was sold as a double but it would be small even for a single room â€“ you would only fit in it if you were a slim single person with very small piece of hand luggage. When I asked was there anything that would actually fit two bodies and luggage, I was shown another room that was even worse, very slightly bigger but in the lower ground with absolutely no natural light. So we stayed in Rm 41. Never again. The double bed was pushed against the wall and there was barely room then to walk between the bed and the other wall, against which clothes were also supposed to hang! The Â¾ size door to the miniscule bathroom couldnâ€™t open all the way because the bed was in the way. The â€˜kitchenetteâ€™ is a sink-sized bench in the corner with mini fridge underneath, It has 2 hotplates on the side of a very tiny sink and a toaster, but there is absolutely no room to actually do anything with it. There are no teabags, no bedside tables, no reading lights, no hairdryer, no air conditioning, and you have to pay a deposit for the remote controls for the TV (though arenâ€™t told this on check in). The website we went to said it had wi-fi but the coverage didnâ€™t reach our room; it was also going to be charged at Â£3/hr! The walls and ceilings are paper thin so you hear every movement around and above you. The furniture and fittings are new-ish but the watermarks on the walls are old and overall it just isnâ€™t a functional space unless you literally take the one step from the door to the bed, sleep, and go out again. The people in the office were pleasant and tried to respond to our concerns but there wasnâ€™t much they could do. This is a case of greed overriding functionality. Our advice â€“ donâ€™t do it! It is a great area (we used to live around here) and there are loads of hotels. You will be able to find others that are also reasonably priced and that you can actually move around in.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: AmyTarka
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE. We were sent here from their partner hotel as our room had a leak (apparantly) - no warning before we got there. We didn't know until we'd paid for a our room that there was actually no room for us and we were being put in one of the staffs rooms who was away for the weekend - sheets covering his belongins and a put me up bed as we'd booked for 3. Complete with porn stash in bedside table!! Manager was just rude when we complained and acted like he was doing us a favour!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: goodtimes71
Reviews.Content: I got quite a good deal as I booked this place through laterooms.com If I'd paid the full usual rate they have I'd have been furious. My room was falling to pieces, there were damp marks on the walls, the tap wasn't working well, the walls are so thin and it's so noisy in the morning you can't sleep. Staff were friendly but it has so many problems I don't think I'd ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as it seems after all the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Barsuchok
Reviews.Content: Well, for the price we paid (135 for 2 nights) I was OK with this hotel. The rooms were clean, kitchenette was very convinient: kettle, microwave, toaster, fridge - everything you need if on the budget and prefer to have a quick bite at the rooms. Staff was very polite with us and helpful. Yes rooms are tiny, but in London in such a price range I believe it"s common. We booked a twin room, but were allocated, at first, a double one. After noting this out to the staff, they granted us a key from a single room next to ours. So we've got 2 rooms at our disposal. To compare - both were clean and decent. But a single, of course, was much smaller with a really tiny bathroom. Double was fine with toilet far from the sink :) On the negative side the double bed was really small and the walls were really thin, I've got an absolutely annoying neighbours who conducted a night style of life and that disturbed a lot. At the end we are just guests and lets respect each others rights for the night sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Dylan Paddington
HotelInfo.Address: 14 Devonshire Terrace | Westminster, London W23DW, England
